result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel A. Aceves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *AMENDMENT 5-7-2021 -  Pursuant to Probation Review Hearing held on 5-6-2021, probation extended one year.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $11,061.50 and restitution surcharge. Restitution is to be FIRST PAID to the victim Kunes Chrysler in the amount of $3,161.50 via wage assignment. The balance of the restitution in the amount of $7,900.00 to QBE Insurance is subject to the Defendant's right to challenge and request of a restitution hearing.
-----------------------------------
*AMENDMENT 5/24/2019 - Judgment of Conviction amended pursuant to Findings of Fact and Conclusion  of Law and Order Filed 7/22/2016 ; defendant has ability to make restitution, and the restitution owed to Kunes Chrysler shall remain in the amount of $3,161.50. The restitution shall be paid via wage assignment or as otherwise ordered by the Court. 
------------------------------------------------

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
----------------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------------------

No contact with victim without victim and probation agent's consent.
----------------------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges commencing on or before 06/14/2016 at 8:00 a.m. Work release to include child care and travel to Illinois for employment purposes.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel A. Aceves

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing
Probation extended one year; new discharge date 05-23-23

Defendant Miguel A. Aceves in court. Agent Janilee Wolff appears in person. JJ Crawford appears for the State.
Agent requests extension of probation.  Defendant makes statement to the court. Court questions Defendant.
Court orders extension for one year.  If restitution is paid off prior to extended date, Defendant can discharge early.
Agent to prepare order.
Memo from DOC re: status of probation
Probation review hearing on April 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Miguel A. Aceves not in court. DOC Agent Janilee Wolff appeared.  J J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Memo submitted by DOC reviewed by parties. Agent makes record that probation fees are still owed. Agent is recommending an extension of one year. State concurs. Court has found defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation one year. Court to prepare an amended Judgment of Conviction reflecting extension.
Memo from DOC re: Probation Review and Probation extension
Probation review hearing on May 6, 2021 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Original Warrant filed with the court.

Defendant Miguel A. Aceves in court with attorney Leslie Lynn Johnson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Janilee Wolff appears for DOC. Warrant quashed. Deft didn't realize he had to appear. Probation extended for 2 years or until restitution is paid in full. Minutes filed.
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction - extending probation from 5/23/2019 to 05/23/2021

08:34 AM  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Andrew Herrmann appears on behalf of the State.  
Probation Agent Janilee Wolff appears on behalf of DOC.  
Defendant is not present.  
Matter is on for a probation review hearing.  Court makes record that Agent Wolff sent a letter informing the Court that Mr. Aceves still owes about $12,000 + in restitution and has not paid since December of 2016.  Agent Wolff did send the deft a letter on March 12 advising him of today's Court appearance.  Court would like a warrant issued for defendant's arrest.  Agent got a progress report with his Illinois supervising agent that he was reporting to Agent in Illinois.  Court will issue a bench warrant for defendant.  This was not a "must notify" case so victim was not noticed.  8:36 am  Court in recess.
Memo from DOC re: update on probation status; PRH 5/16/19
Probation review hearing on May 16, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Court in session at 10:12 am.

Discussion as to restitution amounts being claimed. Proof of Service filed. Restitution to be set at zero to QBE Insurance. Restitution to Kunes is set at stipulated amount per Judgment of  Conviction. Findings of Fact and Conclusions of Law and Order on Restitution Hearing to be prepared by Court. Court in recess at 10:18 am. Minutes filed.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
8:31 AM  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Miguel A. Aceves in court with Atty Leslie L. Johnson.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  
Attorney Johnson recites the terms of the plea agreement.  
Defendant will have a wage assignment and will pay $57.70 per week from his pay check to be applied first toward his restitution obligation to the victim Kunes Chrysler.  The balance of the restitution in the amount of $7,900 is to the Insurance Company and the Defendant will be requesting a restitution hearing on that portion of the restitution.  Parties are agreeing to a 3 year period of probation because of the restitution.  
Atty Donohoo makes record as to victim notification.  
Court Imposes the agreed upon sentence of the parties:  

Sentence withheld, Three (3) years probation

CONDITIONS:
Thirty (30) days in Jail with work release commencing on or before June 14, 2016 at 8:00 a.m.  Work release to include child care and travel to Illinois for employment purposes.  
Pay restitution in the amount of $11,061.50.  Restitution is to be FIRST PAID to the victim Kunes Chrysler in the amount of $3,161.50 via wage assignment.  The balance of the restitutition in the amount of $7,900.00 to QBE Insurance is subject to the Defendant's right to challenge and request a restitution hearing.  
Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent
No contact with victim without victim and probation agent's consent
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

One (1) day sentence credit if probation is revoked.  

Defendant does not wish to make a statement.  

8:35 am  Court in recess.

8:39 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  
Atty Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deft Miguel A. Aceves in court with Atty Leslie L. Johnson.  
Atty Johnson has had discussions with Atty Donohoo  just prior to court and parties have done some further negotiations.  Defendant was hoping to have $3,000 to apply toward restitution and is expecting the money to come through from his family within the next 2 weeks.  Atty Johnson is proposing a wage assignment until the money comes through but Atty Donohoo first needs to be able to discuss this further with the victim.  Response by Atty Donohoo that she is not objecting to a continuance so they can get this straightened out.  Court asks for clarification with regard to the total amount of the restitution being requested.  Response by both Atty Johnson and Atty Donohoo.  Court will grant a continuance if there is no objection from the State.  Sentencing hearing rescheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am before Judge Reddy.

Defendant Miguel A. Aceves in court with attorney Leslie L. Johnson.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Miguel A. Aceves in court with attorney Leslie L. Johnson.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Miguel A. Aceves in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH KUNES COUNTRY CAR DEALERSHIP OR S.K. OR W.M.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant in court in custody with attorney M. Nepomiachi. Matthew Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
